intro: Eremosis melanocarpa, commonly known as the blackleaf dandelion, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped, dark green leaves with a waxy coating. The plant produces a single, bright yellow composite flower that blooms in the spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The species is notable for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
